intro: Goniothalamus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered goniothalamus, is a member of the Annonaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in lowland rainforests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
